column1: #Text=Owen Ford left Four Winds the next morning .
#Text=In the evening Anne went over to see Leslie , but found nobody .
#Text=The house was locked and there was no light in any window .
#Text=It looked like a home left soulless .
#Text=Leslie did not run over on the following day -- which Anne thought a bad sign .
#Text=Gilbert having occasion to go in the evening to the fishing cove , Anne drove with him to the Point , intending to stay awhile with Captain Jim .
#Text=But the great light , cutting its swathes through the fog of the autumn evening , was in care of Alec Boyd and Captain Jim was away .

#Text= I do n't want to go to the cove -- but I 'll go over the channel with you , and roam about on the sand shore till you come back .

#Text= exclaimed Anne in amazement .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Well , I came here because I wanted to walk -- and walk -- and WALK , " said Leslie restlessly .

column1: #Text=" I could n't on the rock shore -- the tide was too high and the rocks prisoned me .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Leslie , dearest , what is the trouble ?

#Text= demanded Leslie in a fierce , low tone .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I do n't think you any of those things .

_	_	_	_

#Text= But -- oh , it 's so -- so shameful , " murmured Leslie .

column1: #Text=" To love him -- unsought -- and when I 'm not free to love anybody .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= I did n't LEARN to care , " said Leslie , walking on and speaking passionately .

column1: #Text=" If it had been like that I could have prevented it .

column3:
_	_	_	_
